'''Spiritfox Sin-Eater''' is [[Yae Miko]]'s [[Normal Attack]].

==Gameplay Notes== 
* Yae Miko's Charged Attack can only deal DMG to the same enemy once per '''0.5''' seconds, as limited by the [[Damage Sequence]] mechanic.
** Against enemies with large enough hitboxes, a single Charged Attack can deal up to '''2''' instances of DMG.

==Trivia==
* Yae Miko's weapon does not appear during her Normal Attacks, but it does appear during her Charged and Plunging Attacks.

===Etymology===
* The Chinese and Japanese versions use the term ''shiki'' ("law," "ceremony," or "formula"), which in the context of mystic arts is used as a shortened form of ''{{w|shikigami}}'', or supernatural familiars in {{w|Onmyōdō|Onmyoudou}} (a type of yin-yang philosophy in Japan). While paper-familiars are the most famous type in folk tales (as in [[Shiki Taishou]] in this game), other spirits can be summoned as ''shikigami'' as well. Onmyoudou is often associated with fox spirits and there even is a folk legend that the onmyouji {{w|Abe no Seimei|Seimei}}'s mother {{w|Kuzunoha}} was a divine kitsune goddess who served the great god Inari.
